CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: However , the rms roughness is somewhat reduced to from 0.47 to 0.43 nm with thermal treatment , being favorable for charge separation and transport. This can reasonably explain the enhanced efficiency via the postannealing effect. Note that , in stark contrast to PCDTBT : PC71BM system in which thermal annealing reduced the photovoltaic parameters ( FF , J SC , and V OC ) , 22 the performance of all PCDSeBT - based devices for this study is considerably improved as a result of thermal treatment. We can conclude that the formation of crystalline nanoscale domains would be slightly induced in PCDSeBT : PC71BM with a thermal treatment in consequence of the ordered crystalline nature of the PCDSeBT on annealing as supported by the XRD results above as well as the large quinoidal character in the polymer backbone as the inclusion of selenophene. 23 The AFM of the annealed film gives an evidence for slightly nanofibril - like organization ( see Figure 5b ). The hole and electron mobilities of PCDSeBT : PC71BM ( 1 : 4 w / w ) blends were measured using the space - charge - limited current ( SCLC ) method and the J-V characteristics were plotted in Figure 6. The hole mobility ( μ hole = 4.68 × 10^-5 cm^2 / V°s ) obtained with the thermally annealed film is one order higher than that without post annealing ( μ hole = 4.02 × 10^-6 cm^2 / V°s ) , whereas in the both cases , the electron mobilities ( μ electron ) are similar ( 1.24 × 10^-3 and 5.58 × 10^-3 cm^2 / V°s ) for as-cast and annealed films , respectively , yielding a smaller difference between the mobility ratio for the annealed film. The higher mobilities and more balanced charge transport should definitely favor the charge transportation in the blend film and lead to high solar cell performance , supporting the b e n e fi c i a l e ff e c t o f t h e t h e r m a l a n n e a l i n g o n PCDSeBT : PC71BM cells . In conclusion , diselenienylbenzothiadiazole ( DSeBT ) units have successfully been incorporated into a D-A polymer backbone by Suzuki polymerization with 2,7-carbazole comonomer , affording a poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) ( PCDSeBT ) ; This design motif is that replacement of thiophenes to selenophene units in PCDTBT that acts as a superior p - type photoactive material for PSCs , induces a lower bandgap ( 1.70 eV ) than that of PCDTBT ( 1.85 eV ) , while the ideal HOMO energy level ( -5.40 eV ) is still maintained.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PCDSeBT: This is mentioned several times in the paragraph as the name of the material.
2. PC71BM: This is also mentioned several times as the name of the material.
3. PCDTBT: This is mentioned once in the paragraph as the name of a material that is different from PCDSeBT.
4. DSeBT: This is mentioned once in the paragraph as a component of the PCDSeBT material.
5. 2,7-carbazole: This is mentioned once in the paragraph as a comonomer used in the synthesis of PCDSeBT.

So, the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. PCDSeBT
2. PC71BM
3. PCDTBT
4. DSeBT
5. 2,7-carbazole
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to "Material Name" in the paragraph:

1. PCDSeBT
2. PC71BM

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer directly to "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities that refer to "Material Name" in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDSeBT |
| PC71BM |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: However , the rms roughness is somewhat reduced to from 0.47 to 0.43 nm with thermal treatment , being favorable for charge separation and transport. This can reasonably explain the enhanced efficiency via the postannealing effect. Note that , in stark contrast to PCDTBT : PC71BM system in which thermal annealing reduced the photovoltaic parameters ( FF , J SC , and V OC ) , 22 the performance of all PCDSeBT - based devices for this study is considerably improved as a result of thermal treatment. We can conclude that the formation of crystalline nanoscale domains would be slightly induced in PCDSeBT : PC71BM with a thermal treatment in consequence of the ordered crystalline nature of the PCDSeBT on annealing as supported by the XRD results above as well as the large quinoidal character in the polymer backbone as the inclusion of selenophene. 23 The AFM of the annealed film gives an evidence for slightly nanofibril - like organization ( see Figure 5b ). The hole and electron mobilities of PCDSeBT : PC71BM ( 1 : 4 w / w ) blends were measured using the space - charge - limited current ( SCLC ) method and the J-V characteristics were plotted in Figure 6. The hole mobility ( μ hole = 4.68 × 10^-5 cm^2 / V°s ) obtained with the thermally annealed film is one order higher than that without post annealing ( μ hole = 4.02 × 10^-6 cm^2 / V°s ) , whereas in the both cases , the electron mobilities ( μ electron ) are similar ( 1.24 × 10^-3 and 5.58 × 10^-3 cm^2 / V°s ) for as-cast and annealed films , respectively , yielding a smaller difference between the mobility ratio for the annealed film. The higher mobilities and more balanced charge transport should definitely favor the charge transportation in the blend film and lead to high solar cell performance , supporting the b e n e fi c i a l e ff e c t o f t h e t h e r m a l a n n e a l i n g o n PCDSeBT : PC71BM cells . In conclusion , diselenienylbenzothiadiazole ( DSeBT ) units have successfully been incorporated into a D-A polymer backbone by Suzuki polymerization with 2,7-carbazole comonomer , affording a poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) ( PCDSeBT ) ; This design motif is that replacement of thiophenes to selenophene units in PCDTBT that acts as a superior p - type photoactive material for PSCs , induces a lower bandgap ( 1.70 eV ) than that of PCDTBT ( 1.85 eV ) , while the ideal HOMO energy level ( -5.40 eV ) is still maintained.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph! Here are the materials mentioned, along with their property names:

1. Material: PCDSeBT
Property name: Polymer
2. Material: PC71BM
Property name: Polymer
3. Material: PCDTBT
Property name: Polymer

Property name: Aromatic compound

Property name: Aromatic compound

Property name: Energy level

Property name: Energy level
10. Material: FF (Fill Factor)
Property name: Efficiency parameter
11. Material: J SC (Short-circuit Current)
Property name: Current density
12. Material: V OC (Open-circuit Voltage)
Property name: Voltage
13. Material: Mobility (hole mobility and electron mobility)
Property name: Transport coefficient

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to the property name of materials in the paragraph:

1. Material: PCDSeBT
Property name: Polymer
2. Material: PC71BM
Property name: Polymer
3. Material: PCDTBT
Property name: Polymer

I removed the following entities that do not refer to the property name of materials:

1. 2,7-carbazole (this refers to an aromatic compound)

Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: However , the rms roughness is somewhat reduced to from 0.47 to 0.43 nm with thermal treatment , being favorable for charge separation and transport. This can reasonably explain the enhanced efficiency via the postannealing effect. Note that , in stark contrast to PCDTBT : PC71BM system in which thermal annealing reduced the photovoltaic parameters ( FF , J SC , and V OC ) , 22 the performance of all PCDSeBT - based devices for this study is considerably improved as a result of thermal treatment. We can conclude that the formation of crystalline nanoscale domains would be slightly induced in PCDSeBT : PC71BM with a thermal treatment in consequence of the ordered crystalline nature of the PCDSeBT on annealing as supported by the XRD results above as well as the large quinoidal character in the polymer backbone as the inclusion of selenophene. 23 The AFM of the annealed film gives an evidence for slightly nanofibril - like organization ( see Figure 5b ). The hole and electron mobilities of PCDSeBT : PC71BM ( 1 : 4 w / w ) blends were measured using the space - charge - limited current ( SCLC ) method and the J-V characteristics were plotted in Figure 6. The hole mobility ( μ hole = 4.68 × 10^-5 cm^2 / V°s ) obtained with the thermally annealed film is one order higher than that without post annealing ( μ hole = 4.02 × 10^-6 cm^2 / V°s ) , whereas in the both cases , the electron mobilities ( μ electron ) are similar ( 1.24 × 10^-3 and 5.58 × 10^-3 cm^2 / V°s ) for as-cast and annealed films , respectively , yielding a smaller difference between the mobility ratio for the annealed film. The higher mobilities and more balanced charge transport should definitely favor the charge transportation in the blend film and lead to high solar cell performance , supporting the b e n e fi c i a l e ff e c t o f t h e t h e r m a l a n n e a l i n g o n PCDSeBT : PC71BM cells . In conclusion , diselenienylbenzothiadiazole ( DSeBT ) units have successfully been incorporated into a D-A polymer backbone by Suzuki polymerization with 2,7-carbazole comonomer , affording a poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) ( PCDSeBT ) ; This design motif is that replacement of thiophenes to selenophene units in PCDTBT that acts as a superior p - type photoactive material for PSCs , induces a lower bandgap ( 1.70 eV ) than that of PCDTBT ( 1.85 eV ) , while the ideal HOMO energy level ( -5.40 eV ) is still maintained.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the values of material properties in the paragraph! Here are the values of the material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Rms roughness: 0.43 nm (mentioned in the first sentence)
2. Thermal treatment temperature: not mentioned explicitly, but the paragraph mentions that the thermal treatment reduces the rms roughness from 0.47 to 0.43 nm.
3. Photovoltaic parameters (FF, JSC, and VOC): not mentioned explicitly, but the paragraph notes that thermal annealing improves the efficiency of PCDSeBT : PC71BM devices.
4. Hole mobility: 4.68 × 10^-5 cm^2 / V°s (mentioned in the third sentence)
5. Electron mobility: 1.24 × 10^-3 cm^2 / V°s (mentioned in the third sentence)
6. Difference between mobility ratio for annealed and as-cast films: not mentioned explicitly, but the paragraph notes that the mobility ratio is smaller for the annealed film.
7. Bandgap: 1.70 eV (mentioned in the fifth sentence)
8. HOMO energy level: -5.40 eV (mentioned in the fifth sentence)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
